results.name: a(0) = 0, a(1) = 1, and for n>=2, a(n) = (n-1) * a(n-2) + (n-2) * a(n-1).
comment: Previous name was: Weighted Fibonacci numbers.

The sequence occurs in the evaluation of the integral I(n) := int {u = 0..inf} exp(-u)*u^n/(1 + u) du. The result is I(n) = A153229(n) + (-1)^n*I(0), where I(0) = int {0..inf} exp(-u)/(1 + u) du = 0.5963473623... is known as Gompertz's constant. See A073003. Note also that I(n) = n!*int {u = 0..inf} exp(-u)/(1 + u)^(n+1) du. (End)
((-1)^(n+1))*a(n) = p(n,-1), where the polynomials p are defined at A248664.   - _Clark Kimberling_, Oct 11 2014

G.f.: 2*x/(1+x)/G(0), where G(k)= 1 + 1/(1 - 1/(1 - 1/(2*x*(k+1)) + 1/G(k+1))); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, May 29 2013
G.f.: W(0)*x/(1+sqrt(x))/(1+x), where W(k) = 1 + sqrt(x)/( 1 - sqrt(x)*(k+1)/(sqrt(x)*(k+1) + 1/W(k+1) )); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Aug 17 2013
a(n) ~ (n-1)! * (1 - 1/n + 1/n^3 + 1/n^4 - 2/n^5 - 9/n^6 - 9/n^7 + 50/n^8 + 267/n^9 + 413/n^10), where numerators are Rao Uppuluri-Carpenter numbers, see A000587. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 16 2015
